pullRequest.body:
Construct measurable equivalence for the following equiv and then prove that they are measure preserving: 
- `Equiv.arrowProdEquivProdArrow`
- `Equiv.arrowCongr'`
- `Equiv.prodAssoc`

Also, we fix a typo in [MeasureTheory.measurePreserving_pi](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/MeasureTheory/Constructions/Pi.html#MeasureTheory.measurePreserving_pi)

This PR is part of the proof of the Analytic Class Number Formula.

 ---

if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

Thanks!
I hope the new linter will flag this as well, but it looks like you forgot some `Â·`s
Yes please, unless you're only adding it because `arrowCongr'` ends in a `'`, in which case you can use the `set_option` locally
Oh, somehow, the docstrings got lost on the way ðŸ˜… I'll fix that. Thanks!
I put some more descriptive docstrings.
This `rfl` seems to indicate there's one or more missing lemmas
I added some more lemmas to the `simp` and the `rfl` disappeared
Idem

```suggestion
    [âˆ€ i, SigmaFinite (Î½ i)] (eÎ± : Î±â‚ â‰ƒ Î±â‚‚) (eÎ² : Î²â‚ â‰ƒáµ Î²â‚‚)
```
Since your assumptions are data, the letter `h` is probably not the best choice.

```suggestion
variable (Î¼a Î¼b Î¼c) in
/-- The measurable equiv induced by the equiv `(Î± Ã— Î²) Ã— Î³ â‰ƒ Î± Ã— (Î² Ã— Î³)` is measure preserving. -/
theorem _root_.MeasureTheory.measurePreserving_prodAssoc [SFinite Î¼a] [SFinite Î¼b]
    [SFinite Î¼c] :
    MeasurePreserving (MeasurableEquiv.prodAssoc : (Î± Ã— Î²) Ã— Î³ â‰ƒáµ Î± Ã— Î² Ã— Î³)
      ((Î¼a.prod Î¼b).prod Î¼c) (Î¼a.prod (Î¼b.prod Î¼c)) where
  measurable := MeasurableEquiv.prodAssoc.measurable
  map_eq := by
    ext s hs
    have A (x : Î±) : MeasurableSet (Prod.mk x â»Â¹' s) := measurable_prod_mk_left hs
    have B : MeasurableSet (MeasurableEquiv.prodAssoc â»Â¹' s) := 
      MeasurableEquiv.prodAssoc.measurable hs
    simp_rw [map_apply MeasurableEquiv.prodAssoc.measurable hs, prod_apply hs, prod_apply (A _),
      prod_apply B, lintegral_prod _ (measurable_measure_prod_mk_left B).aemeasurable]
    rfl
```
You can weaken the assumptions from `SigmaFinite` to `SFinite` (but for this you need to put it later in the file, because it uses `lintegral_prod`).
Indeed (and in fact `lint` tells me that `SFinite Î¼a` is not even needed). Thanks!

pullRequest.title: feat(MeasureTheory): prove that some equivalences are measure preserving
